Ru_trainchinese: qī: (прил) холодный, прохладный; пустынный, унылый, скорбный
humanum_full_description_en:
From " heart ", " wife " sound. The original meaning is grief and sadness. "Said Wen": "Sorrowful, painful. From the heart, the wife's voice." Such as "Chu Ci. "Farward Travel": "Suddenly wandering from a lack of meaning, sadness and sorrow." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "Sorrow, pain." "Han Shu. Yan Zhu Wuqiu Master Xu Yanzhuan King Jia Chuan": "Your Majesty is worthy of heaven and earth, the sun and the moon are bright, the grace to the beasts, the grass and the trees, and one person is hungry and cold and does not die in his life. It is sad for the heart."

" Qi " can also mean cold, the same as " Qi ". Such as "The Jade Terrace." Qin Jia "Gift to the Woman": "Severe frost and sadness, snow covering the courtyard." "Selected Works. Liu Gongqian "Gift from the younger brother": "Frost is miserable, and always corrects every year." Lu Yanji's note: "Miserable, cold."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " heart ", " wife " sound. The original meaning is grief and sadness.
humanum_full_description:
從「心」，「妻」聲。本義是悲痛、悲傷。《說文》：「悽，痛也。从心，妻聲。」如《楚辭．遠遊》：「意荒忽而流蕩兮，心愁悽而增悲。」洪興祖補注：「悽，痛也。」《漢書．嚴朱吾丘主父徐嚴終王賈傳》：「陛下德配天地，明象日月，恩至禽獸，澤及草木，一人有飢寒不終其天年而死者，為之悽愴於心。」

　　「悽」亦可表示寒冷，同「淒」。如《玉臺新詠．秦嘉〈贈婦〉》：「嚴霜悽愴，飛雪覆庭。」《文選．劉公幹〈贈從弟〉》：「冰霜正慘悽，終歲常端正。」呂延濟注：「慘悽，寒皃。」
humanum_short_description: 從「心」，「妻」聲。本義是悲痛、悲傷。

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 忄 [ xīn ] heart; mind; soul
    • 妻 [ qī ] wife
Pictophonetic: 妻 indicates the sound; 忄 (heart) conveys the meaning.

從「 心 」，「 妻 」聲。本義是悲痛、悲傷。《說文》：「悽，痛也。从心，妻聲。」如《楚辭．遠遊》：「意荒忽而流蕩兮，心愁悽而增悲。」洪興祖補注：「悽，痛也。」《漢書．嚴朱吾丘主父徐嚴終王賈傳》：「陛下德配天地，明象日月，恩至禽獸，澤及草木，一人有飢寒不終其天年而死者，為之悽愴於心。」 「 悽 」亦可表示寒冷，同「 淒 」。如《玉臺新詠．秦嘉〈贈婦〉》：「嚴霜悽愴，飛雪覆庭。」《文選．劉公幹〈贈從弟〉》：「冰霜正慘悽，終歲常端正。」呂延濟注：「慘悽，寒皃。」
From " heart", " wife" sound. The original meaning is grief and sadness. "Said Wen": "Sorrowful, painful. From the heart, the wife's voice." Such as "Chu Ci. "Farward Travel": "Suddenly wandering from a lack of meaning, sadness and sorrow." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "Sorrow, pain." "Han Shu. Yan Zhu Wuqiu Master Xu Yanzhuan King Jia Chuan": "Your Majesty is worthy of heaven and earth, the sun and the moon are bright, the grace to the beasts, the grass and the trees, and one person is hungry and cold and does not die in his life. It is sad for the heart." " Qi" can also mean cold, the same as " Qi". Such as "The Jade Terrace." Qin Jia "Gift to the Woman": "Severe frost and sadness, snow covering the courtyard." "Selected Works. Liu Gongqian "Gift from the younger brother": "Frost is miserable, and always corrects every year." Lu Yanji's note: "Miserable, cold."

悽字的基本解释

悽
qī
同“凄”②。

悽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qī］
［《廣韻》七稽切，平齊，清。］
亦作“恓1”。
(1)悲痛，悲伤。
(2)寒冷。参见“悽愴”。
[②]［xī］
同“棲2”。

悽字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　悽； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页389第19
【唐韻】七稽切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】千西切，?音妻。【說文】痛也。从心妻聲。【集韻】悲也。【後漢·喬公祖傳】曹操過其墓，輒悽愴致祭奠。　又悽悽，饑病貌。【後漢·周黃徐姜申屠列傳贊】悽悽碩人，陵阿窮退。　又【韻會】七計切。恨也。

悽字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
悽字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［qī］
["Guangyun" seven cuts, level, and clear. ]
Also known as "恓1".
(1) Grief, sadness.
(2) Cold. See "sorrowful".
[②]［xī］
Same as "Rost 2".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Ji 1] [Heart Word Department] 　倀; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 389 Page 19
[Tang Yun] Qi Ji cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Qianxi Qi,? Yin wife. [Said the text] It hurts too. From the heart of the wife's voice. 【Jiyun】Sorrowful. [Later Han·Qiaogong's Ancestor Biography] Cao Cao passed his tomb, mourning memorially.　It's miserable and hungry. [The Biographies and Compliments of the Later Han·Zhou Huangxu Jiang Shentu] A sorrowful man, Ling Aqiong retired.　[Rhyme Club] Seven ways to cut. Hate too.
